answers.answer: Yes, it is possible that he has a third nerve palsy which would explain both his symptoms.  These palsies can be caused by small vessel athersclerosis, diabetes, strokes, tumors and aneurysyms among other things so it is a very serious situation and deserves an MRI, possibly an MRI and a full neurologic evaluation.MJK MD

question: My husband's right eye has turned outward and causing him to have double vision when both eyes are open.  Now his right eye lid will not stay open.  He can open it by himself a little bit but it just closes and stays closed after that.  His doctor is sending him to have an MRI on his thrid orbital nerve.  I was wondering if the damage to this nerve could cause both problems and how long it will take to heal?  Could this also be a form of bell's palsy?
title: Third Orbital Nerve
